tweets.text: @Guru_GyanKhoji @kareem_carr No, I think that "they" (i.e. Guido) just didn't think of it, not being R users. The fact that in R, things like print(), plot(), summary() etc. are so-called 'generic' functions is one of the real strengths of R. Too bad those Python snobs (I do NOT mean Guido) don't know it.

One of the many reasons I chose #R. 

True story. üßµ

#datascience #career #rstats #excel https://t.co/ihb0b6AdmF

p-value: probability of getting, in another study, a result more impressive than that observed in the current study given the true effect is zero

How is this useful? You‚Äôre conditioning on what you want to know, the effect! H/T @f2harrell BBR

#rstats brainstorming: If I wanted to devise an algorithm that could take a ggplot chart (like this example) and identify rectangular areas of the chart with NO data graphed on them (for putting a legend or inset), how would I go about this? (Alternatively, does this exist?) https://t.co/NM206ZpFIL

For the #rstats #ShinyApp experts out there: is there a recommended fixed width for figures‚Äîor do you all allow for variable width? I have thoughts on this from running websites but would be curious what the norm is in this area.

Check out the workshop on "Machine Learning for Drug Discovery" featuring fantastic speakers 
@CarolineUhler, @mmbronstein, @OkkoClev, @lizbwood, @fabian_theis & @RGBLabMIT

üö©When? on May 5 (hybrid)
‚û°Ô∏èLink: https://t.co/MeuhxhZpMa
üìßmldd.workshop@gmail.com https://t.co/GE0enJbDxZ

New #tutorial covering how to combine dataframes, add variables, drop variables, rename variables, and group cases in #R with #dplyr. It may seem basic, but computing software is not always intuitive, and everyone has to start somewhere! Up on my website now.

@tanya_shapiro This guide is helpful for scrollytelling in general... I just know my audience will want to be browsing it on their phone. https://t.co/8V5qLxM6Uy  + mashing it with @skyetetra 's guide. https://t.co/YDLy7V7Cmf

But I'm wondering if someone has written this combo as a blog.

I tried to switch my #RStats workflow from #RStudio to #vscode several times. I failed repeatedly because I could not find an overwhelming advantage of VSCode. If you're a VSCode R user: What's your main argument for not using RStudio (anymore)?
Bonus points if they are made with #rstats! https://t.co/m8l6FYOJXC

tweets.text: Day 1 (July 24) will focus on #RemoteSensing and include an intro talk with @MagicalSystems, a keynote talk by @e_calamita, and a hands-on #rstats workshop with D Maciel, where you'll learn how to access @USGSLandsat @NASA_Landsat data and make #waterquality estimates.

We're also VERY excited about THREE DAYS of workshops prior to the summit! These will focus on #RemoteSensing #DataScience #BigData #Hydrology #Limnology #Rstats 
https://t.co/FCADbfBcGo

The summit will also have 2 panels:
One is a listening session where the org team can hear from you about why you appreciate @HackingLimno!
The second will be a #Careers in #DataScience #OpenScience with @jawzsh @oh_sk @Water_Rox @anikasneaka and E Read!

The @LivUniCBF are co-hosting the next NothernBUG with our colleagues in the @CGR_UoL! :) It's is a user group meeting for bioinformaticians, computational biologists, or anyone interested in bioinformatics and a great place to present your work! It's free & open to all too https://t.co/J56ZXAedgM

@FC_rstats @mustangostang Nice! I've produced similar scouting reports with GPT-3.5 in the past. However, I fed in raw statistical data which the model still had to interpret. While GPT-3.5 already did a reasonable job, I imagine that GPT-4 would do even better.

@JoshAHobbs @JanVanHaaren @mustangostang @JoshAHobbs If you gave it well documented profiles and core reporting questions and built out this prompt - it would probably provide a great facilitation document

@jdeposicion @FC_rstats @JanVanHaaren @mustangostang ChatGPT is great but using OpenAI modules incorporating other tools like @LangChainAI  is crucial for maximizing value. I may just be a student, but it baffles me why even the experts in ‚öΩÔ∏è seem to have trouble grasping the potential of these technologies.
@DatoBHJ @FC_rstats @JanVanHaaren @mustangostang Been playing w GPT the last weeks w football stuff, just haven't had time to exploit it more. But pretty sure clubs will watch for it too

@FC_rstats @JanVanHaaren @mustangostang Surprised that ‚öΩÔ∏è fans & experts aren't more hyped about the potential of this field in the sport. With prompt engineering techniques and data interpretation plugins, it could be a game changer. It's even overwhelming! Hard to keep up with the constant stream of new LLM projects.

@Guru_GyanKhoji @kareem_carr Compared with Python, #Rstats has 2 main lacks: a. Threading capability. b. Easy coding of linked data structures. (a) is addressed by my Rdsm pkg, and (b) could be handled in various ways. But there is no strong demand for either, so it won't get done.

Traditional approaches for time-series forecasting are certainly the most downloaded. 

Solid pkgs like TBATS have high downloads, even w/  low stars. Py-Prophet is as popular as it is downloaded. @sktime_toolbox takes 2nd place in popularity and 3rd place in downloads.
